description:
Kill weeds while greening your lawn

Get professional-level weed control with our iron-powered formulas that work as hard as you do.

This complete kit combines two proven solutions: Weed & Green's pre-emergent concentrate prevents crabgrass and controls broadleaf weeds while greening your lawn, plus Dandelion Doom post-emergent for precise spot treatment of breakthrough weeds. Each comes with its own specialized sprayer for optimal coverage. Bonus? You can also use Weed & Green as a post-emergent for heavy weed presence and faster green up. Perfect for homeowners wanting season-long weed control without harsh chemicals.

sections.product_features:
Prevents crabgrass and kills broadleaf weeds
Suppresses moss, algae, and lawn diseases
Iron formula greens up lawn quickly
Two specialized sprayers for precise application
Works on all turfgrass types
Fast-acting formulas
No harsh chemicals
sections.whats_included:
One Weed & Green Hose-end Spray pre-emergent and post-emergent lawn-safe formula made from iron with hose-end sprayer attachment
One Dandelion Doom Concentrate post-emergent iron formula for targeted broadleaf weed control in lawns
One Sunday Herbicide Pouch with Wand Sprayer: For herbicide mixing and precise application
sections.instructions:
For best results, apply in spring or fall when temperatures are between 55-75°F. Apply Weed & Green as prevention, then spot-treat breakthrough weeds with Dandelion Doom.
Apply Weed & Green: Attach sprayer to hose, turn on water and valve. Apply evenly across lawn, avoiding hardscapes. Let dry completely and reapply every 3-6 weeks up to 2x per year. For prevention: Apply in early spring when average temps reach 50-55°F For existing weeds: Use anytime spring through fall
For prevention: Apply in early spring when average temps reach 50-55°F
For existing weeds: Use anytime spring through fall
Apply Dandelion Doom Concentrate: Mix herbicide concentrate and water in herbicide pouch. Attach motorized wand sprayer. Spot treat weeds in lawn and landscape. Let dry completely and reapply every 4-6 weeks up to 4x per year.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Yard Advisors:
What does each product in this pre-emergent and post-emergent weed kit control?
Weed & Green acts as both a pre-emergent weed preventer and post-emergent weed killer, stopping crabgrass and broadleaf weeds before they emerge while controlling existing weeds. Dandelion Doom provides targeted post-emergent control for common lawn weeds like dandelions, clover, chickweed, thistle, and creeping charlie without harming your grass.
When should I apply each lawn weed control product?
Apply Weed & Green as prevention, then spot-treat breakthrough weeds with Dandelion Doom.
Apply Weed & Green pre-emergent in early spring (average temps ~50-55°F) for crabgrass prevention, or anytime spring through fall as a post-emergent broadleaf weed control. Use Dandelion Doom selective weed killer anytime you spot weeds that need targeted treatment in established lawns.
Why does Sunday weed control kit include different sprayers?
Each sprayer is optimized for its specific weed control application - Weed & Green's hose-end sprayer provides broad lawn coverage for pre-emergent and post-emergent treatment, while Dandelion Doom's wand sprayer delivers precise spot treatment for stubborn lawn weeds.
Will Sunday lawn weed control products harm my grass?
Not these formulas! Both are iron-based and lawn-safe weed killers.
Weed and Green can be applied before weeds begin to emerge, even to dormant lawns that aren't yet green and growing. The iron formula of Weed & Green may cause temporary discoloration of grass. But don't worry! Any grayish color is temporary, and grass will return to its natural green as it grows. Overall, these products help your lawn by eliminating weeds while providing iron that supports greener, healthier grass.
Any weed killer application tips or precautions?
Avoid spraying iron-based weed control on hardscapes as it may stain concrete or pavers. Apply when no rain is expected for 24 hours for maximum effectiveness, and let applications dry completely before allowing foot traffic on the treated lawn areas.
Are there any US states where this is not approved for use?
Approved in all states, except CA (pending).
